column4: How can I get rid of the ubuntu login, and just have a command prompt, once I enter my credentials, it will bring me to the desktop
I just run 'sudo update-rc.d gdm defaults' and then I get > i don't have to do anything else?
I type 'sudo update-rc.d gdm defaults' and then it comes up in a new line ' > '
that's becouse bash thinks you hasn't ended the comand so you obviusly misstyped something... do not put the '
Well, I'm wondering what all I can do with ubuntu-server now, am I able to get a graphical interface?
configure it in /etc/network/interfaces and bring it up
I added 'auto eth0' and 'iface eth0 inet dhcp'
